page.title: 06LORRY OWNER IN PARWICH
page.content:
Mr. Lowndes has two lorries. He gets up at about 4.30a.m. By 5.30a.m., he is on the weighbridge in the quarry.
Then he goes into the quarry where most mornings he is loaded with tarmac and then returns to the weighbridge. He then gets a ticket which tells him where to go. He puts the sheet on and begins his journey.
He often does 250-300 miles a day and at about 4.30p.m. he is back at home. He then does odd jobs and fills the lorry with diesel.
The places that he goes to most often are Birmingham, Manchester, Oldham and Coventry.
